constructors.doc: Creates a new . Usually you would then insert it into a with . To perform the creation and insertion in one step, use the convenience function .
constructors.name: new

doc: A is a spot in the buffer where child widgets can be “anchored” (inserted inline, as if they were characters). The anchor can have multiple widgets anchored, to allow for multiple views.

methods.doc: Determines whether a child anchor has been deleted from the buffer. Keep in mind that the child anchor will be unreferenced when removed from the buffer, so you need to hold your own reference (with GObject.Object.prototype.ref) if you plan to use this function — otherwise all deleted child anchors will also be finalized.
methods.name: get_deleted

methods.doc: Gets a list of all widgets anchored at this child anchor. The returned list should be freed with GLib.List.free.
methods.name: get_widgets

name: TextChildAnchor
